definition: to disappear/to vanish/to eliminate/to spend (time)/have to/need
to submerge/to immerse/to sink/to keep down/to lower/to drop/deep/profound/heavy

sentences.english: Idless is the sail of self-pity and depression.
sentences.chinese: 懒惰是催生消沉和自怜自哀的土壤。

sentences.english: Breslau's own research also has suggested tobacco may somehow contribute to depression.
sentences.chinese: 布雷斯劳的研究也表明烟草可能成为消沉的原因。

sentences.english: She grew cross and wearisome, snapping at and teasing Catherine continually.
sentences.chinese: 她变得别扭而且消沉，常常叱骂和戏弄凯瑟琳。

sentences.english: The study suggests it is also linked to depression.
sentences.chinese: 研究表明它与意气消沉也有关系。

sentences.english: Timidity is the bridge to dejection.
He impecunious is demoralized, be reduced to poverty does beggar to street.
sentences.chinese: 身无分文的他意志消沉，沦落到街头做乞丐。

sentences.english: Keep only cheerful friends. The grouches pull you down.
sentences.chinese: 与快乐的人为友，心怀不满的人会让你消沉。

sentences.english: If you think you may be depressed, tell someone.
sentences.chinese: 你若是感觉消沉抑郁，告诉别人。

sentences.english: I swear I'll never fail you in the future.
sentences.chinese: 我矢言我绝不会再让你消沉。

sentences.english: These days, the mood in Yiwu is depressed.
sentences.chinese: 这些天来，义乌市情绪消沉。

sentences.english: Constant criticism is enough to demoralize anybody.
sentences.chinese: 频繁的批评足以使任何人意志消沉。

sentences.english: Demoralization sets in and can become permanent.
sentences.chinese: 开始意志消沉，并可能变成永久性的。

sentences.english: It sinks; and I am ready to depart.
sentences.chinese: 一旦生命的火消沉，我愿悄然长逝。

sentences.english: Feelings of depression or gloominess result from a lack of self confidence.
sentences.chinese: 感到消沉或沮丧的缘由是缺乏自信。

sentences.english: Now droops the milk white peacock like a ghost.
sentences.chinese: 乳白色的孔雀幽灵般消沉。

definition: to bestir oneself/to pull oneself together/to cheer up/to uplift/to stimulate
to abandon oneself to despair/to give up and stop bothering
to be full of remorse/to repent and redress one's errors
one stumble, unable to rise (idiom); a setback leading to total collapse/ruined at a stroke/unable to recover after a minor hitch
to lose (sth)/to drop (sth)/to feel a sense of loss/frustrated/disappointment/loss
